intro: Luziola alabamensis, commonly known as the Alabama bluemink, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or wetland habitats. Its flowers are small, white to pale blue, and bloom in early spring. Due to habitat loss, Luziola alabamensis is considered endangered and is protected under various conservation programs.
